conclusion: Determine which car has a greater magnitude of acceleration during the time interval from t=0 to t=t1 by analyzing the velocity-time graphs.
The graph labeled 'A' represents Car A's velocity-time graph and the graph labeled 'B' represents Car B's velocity-time graph.
At t=0, both cars have the same velocity (v1). Car A's velocity decreases over time, while Car B's velocity increases over time.
Car A's velocity decreases more rapidly than Car B's velocity.
Acceleration is the derivative of velocity with respect to time.
For Car A, the acceleration is given by the slope of the velocity-time graph at any point.
For Car B, the acceleration is given by the slope of the velocity-time graph at any point.
At t=0, the velocity of Car A is v1.
The slope of the velocity-time graph at t=0 is the acceleration of Car A.
Since Car A's velocity decreases over time, its acceleration decreases over time.
At t=0, the velocity of Car B is v1.
The slope of the velocity-time graph at t=0 is the acceleration of Car B.
Since Car B's velocity increases over time, its acceleration increases over time.
The acceleration of Car A decreases over time.
The acceleration of Car B increases over time.
During the time interval from t=0 to t=t1, the magnitude of the acceleration of Car A is greater than the magnitude of the acceleration of Car B.
Final Answer: Car A has a greater magnitude of acceleration than Car B.
